Penerima Bidik Misi SMAN 15 Bandung Terus Bertambah
02 Nov 2019, 23:39 by Dewiyatini
BANDUNG, (PR).- Jumlah penerima bidik misi asal SMAN 15 Bandung terus meningkat. Hal itu sekaligus mengurangi jumlah lulusan yang tidak melanjutkan pendidikan ke perguruan tinggi.
Menurut Kepala SMAN 15 Bandung, Hatta Saputra, sekolahnya berada di wilayah urban. Sehingga, jumlah siswa dari keluarga yang rawan secara ekonomi cukup tinggi. Hal itu berpengaruh juga terhadap minimnya lulusan dari keluarga tersebut yang melanjutkan pendidikan ke perguruan tinggi. 
"Lulusan yang tidak melanjutkan pendidikan memang tinggi. Tapi tiap tahun penerima beasiswa bidik misi juga meningkat. Ini pertanda baik," kata Hatta, pada Kamis, 31 Oktober 2019.
Hatta menyebut, tahun lalu sebanyak 84 lulusan mendapatkan beasiswa bidik misi. Jumlah ini meningkat tajam dari tahun sebelumnya.
Dikatakan Hatta, semangat siswa penerima bidik misi selama sekolah cukup tinggi. Mereka mengisi kegiatan di luar waktu sekolah dengan hal-hal positif. 
"Sebagian besar mengisi kesehariannya dengan kegiatan keagamaan," katanya. 
Hatta mengatakan pihak sekolah terus memberikan semangat pada seluruh siswa agar melanjutkan pendidikan. Persoalan biaya, kata Hatta, yang sering kali jadi kendala dapat diatasi dengan banyaknya sumber beasiswa. 
"Ini juga tugas sekolah untuk membantu siswa mendapatkan banyak informasi dan mematangkan pilihan. Sehingga, berhenti melanjutkan pendidikan tidak perlu jadi pilihan," ujarnya.***

Recipients of SMAN 15 Bandung Mission Continues to Increase
02 Nov 2019, 23:39 by Dewiyatini
BANDUNG, (PR) .- The number of Bidik Misi recipients from SMAN 15 Bandung continues to increase. It also reduces the number of graduates who do not continue their education to college.
According to the Principal of SMAN 15 Bandung, Hatta Saputra, his school is in an urban area. Thus, the number of students from economically vulnerable families is quite high. It also affects the lack of graduates from these families who continue their education to college.
"Graduates who do not continue their education are indeed high. But each year the recipients of Bidik Misi scholarships also increase. This is a good sign," Hatta said, on Thursday, October 31, 2019.
Hatta said, last year as many as 84 graduates received Bidik Misi scholarships. This number increased sharply from the previous year.
Hatta said, the enthusiasm of students receiving Bidik Misi during school was quite high. They fill activities outside of school time with positive things.
"Most of them fill their daily lives with religious activities," he said.
Hatta said the school continued to encourage all students to continue their education. The problem of cost, said Hatta, which is often an obstacle can be overcome by the many sources of scholarships.
"This is also a school assignment to help students get a lot of information and mature choices. So, stopping continuing education does not need to be a choice," he said. ***
